text: The Saint Paul's Vestry House is a historic building in Lynchburg, Virginia, United States. It was built about 1855 and is a single-story Classical Revival-style building with a simple low pitched gable roof and a rectangular plan. It is likely the only vestry house built exclusively for the governing body of an Episcopal Church in Virginia. It also served as the first home of the Lynchburg Woman's Club from 1903 to 1916. and Accompanying photo It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1997. ==References== Category:19th-century Episcopal church buildings Category:Buildings and structures in Lynchburg, Virginia Category:Churches completed in 1855 Category:Episcopal churches in Virginia Category:National Register of Historic Places in Lynchburg, Virginia Category:Neoclassical architecture in Virginia Category:Churches on the National Register of Historic Places in Virginia
title: Saint Paul's Vestry House
